JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Dmitry Dedov;Helen Keller;Helena Jäderblom;Johannes Silvis;Luis López Guerra;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . The applicant was a member of the local anarchist movement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant participated in a public gathering . At TIME the applicant and CARDINAL other persons were apprehended by the police and put in a police vehicle . According to the applicant , the arrest was carried out in a brutal manner : police officers twisted his fingers , gave him several blows on his back and legs and put him face down against the floor of the police vehicle . According to the police reports of DATE , the applicant was inebriated and violently resisted the police .
CARDINAL . The applicant was released at TIME , that is , TIME after his arrest . He was not subject to any prosecution under LAW .

CARDINAL . At TIME on the same date the applicant underwent a medical examination , which concluded that he had bruises and scratches on his face and chest . At TIME he obtained a medical certificate confirming that he was not drunk .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and other persons complained to the NORP district prosecutor ’s office , GPE ( “ the district prosecutor ’s office ” ) about police brutality on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office refused to initiate criminal proceedings against the police officers for lack of evidence of a crime , having concluded that it was impossible to establish whether the officers had inflicted any injuries on the applicant or other persons .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district deputy prosecutor overturned the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office again refused to initiate criminal proceedings on the grounds that the persons participating in the public gathering of CARDINAL DATE had refused to comply with the police order to stop the gathering and had resisted lawful arrest ; accordingly , the police had acted lawfully in order to overcome violent resistance .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he was served with a copy of the decision of CARDINAL DATE on DATE . It remains unclear whether the applicant had attempted to obtain a copy prior to that date .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the decision of DATE before ORG , GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision unlawful on the grounds that the seriousness of the injuries allegedly sustained by the applicant had not been assessed and issued an instruction ordering the prosecutor to re - examine the matter .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office again refused to open an investigation .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he managed to obtain a copy of the decision of DATE on DATE . It remains unclear whether the applicant had attempted to obtain a copy prior to that date .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the decision of DATE before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the refusal of DATE unlawful on the grounds that the seriousness of the injuries allegedly sustained by the applicant had not been assessed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office issued a new refusal to open an investigation on the grounds that it was possible that the injuries had been sustained after the applicant ’s release from the police station .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he received a copy of the decision of CARDINAL October CARDINAL in DATE . It is not known whether the applicant had sought a copy earlier .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer challenged the decision of CARDINAL DATE before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision of CARDINAL DATE unlawful noting the incompleteness of the preinvestigation inquiry .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office issued a new decision refusing to open an investigation .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE the GPE prosecutor ’s office overturned unspecified refusals to open an investigation by the district prosecutor ’s office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and other persons held a picket in front of ORG in GPE . They were arrested as they had failed to duly notify the city authorities of the picket . According to the applicant , he was arrested at TIME When brought to the police vehicle , he received CARDINAL blows to his head . He was then required to sit on the floor of the vehicle . Once in the police station , a police officer inflicted TIME blows to the applicant ’s head and chest . According to the police reports of DATE , the applicant had violently resisted arrest .

CARDINAL . The applicant was released shortly after his arrival at the police station . In the applicant ’s submission , it happened TIME after the arrest . According to the Government , the applicant was arrested at TIME and released at TIME
CARDINAL . At TIME on the same date the applicant underwent a medical examination in a hospital and was diagnosed with bruises and scratches on the body and limbs and a bruise on the chest .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the district prosecutor ’s office of police brutality .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office refused to open an investigation on the grounds that the participants of the picket had violently resisted the police .
CARDINAL . On DATE a Justice of the Peace of GPE Circuit no . CARDINAL imposed on the applicant a fine of MONEY under LAW for his participation in the unauthorised picket .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the refusal of CARDINAL DATE before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision of DATE unlawful .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office again refused to open criminal proceedings against the police officers .
CARDINAL . The applicant allegedly received a copy of the decision of DATE on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the refusal of DATE before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision of DATE unlawful .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office again refused to open an investigation .
CARDINAL . In his submission , the applicant received a copy of the decision of CARDINAL October CARDINAL on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer challenged the refusal of DATE before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision of CARDINAL October CARDINAL unlawful .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE quashed unspecified refusals to open an investigation by the district prosecutor ’s office .
